Reviews.Content: Got off to a bad start here. I don't know if it was my travel agent or the hotel's fault. This is an Inn and Suite hotel. I had told my travel agent I wanted a suite, but when we got there we were in a regular room, but a bit larger than normal. There were 5 of us staying, so I ordered a roll-away, thinking we'd be able to "make do" well after one night it became very apparent that we would NOT be able to make do - so I went to see about getting into a suite. No problem, we were immediately moved to a suite - in fact, they even moved our luggage (as long as it was packed) while we were enjoying Universal. There was no additional charge, which leads me to believe it may have been the hotel's mistake - I was charged for two extra nights of the roll-away, but that was removed from the bill when I questioned it. The suite itself wasn't that special - but did have a mini-fridge, microwave and sleeper sofa (which is all we really needed. Set up was a bit wierd, but it worked for us. No hotel restaurant, but several in the adjacent strip mall. Hotel is in a good location. You could walk to Universal - but only if you're in good shape - I would say it's about a mile. I think there was some mention of a shuttle to the park - well, there was one, but only available once a day each way (which I've found is typical of hotels that offer this service, so I didn't get upset about that). Free cookies and lemonade in the afternoon. Breakfast is offered, but nothing special - waffles, cereal, juice, coffee . . . There was free massages in the lobby one afternoon - don't know if that's a regular thing or not, but it was a nice touch!! Free internet, but not wireless. Free parking - with additional parking in lot across the street (small strip mall). Staff was very friendly and helpful. Pool was placed behind the hotel, so out of the afternoon sun, which was good. We originally had scheduled 3 days here, but extended a couple because we were having a good time.

Reviews.Title: “Most caring hotel staff ever!”
Reviews.Author: Japarican
Reviews.Content: Because of the friendly greeting from Steffanie at check-in, and the attentive service at breakfast from Nadeza, my husband and I both agree our short stay was made relaxing and enjoyable. The reason for our stay was to spend a day at Universal Studios which is right across the street. Because parking at Universal is $14 per car, we thought we would attempt to check in early, leave our car in the free hotel parking lot, and walk to Universal Studios. Since we arrived at the hotel at 12:25 PM, I wasn't optimistic that a room would be ready, but Steffanie happily informed us that there was a room available. It wasn't so much the fact that a room was available that made us feel welcome. It was the way Steffanie greeted us and didn't hesitate to help us that made us feel comfortable and at ease to ask questions. We asked her if it was an easy walk to Universal, and she gave us directions and taxi information in case we chose to ride back by taxi instead of using the shuttle service that only operated at a certain time. After we dropped our luggage off in our room, we opted to walk over to Universal, and it was a nice walk that took us 15 minutes or so. We ended up walking back to the hotel as well. Our room was comfortable and clean. Everything was in working order. In the morning, we went downstairs for the complementary breakfast and we were immediately greeted with the most warm "Good morning!" from Nadeza. Remember this is a self-serve buffet breakfast. Nadeza kept checking to see if we needed anything at our table and brought us yogurt to eat later and bottled water. She cleared dirty plates and bowls from our table too. We watched her as she tended to other guests with the same beautiful smile and cheery attitude. She even gave us each a kiss on the cheek as we left the table and made sure we had our fill of coffee. Upon check-out, we asked Steffanie for directions to an outlet mall nearby. She immediately printed out the directions for us. Nadeza was still in the breakfast area cleaning up with her big smile. When we said goodbye to her, she gave us another kiss on the cheek. My husband and I are both crewmembers with an airline. We travel to different destinations in the world. We have never felt so much at home and at ease as we did during our short stay at this hotel. The reasons for this are found in the caring hearts of Steffanie and Nadeza. We hope they will be there on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Service with a smile!!!”
Reviews.Author: joannemav
Reviews.Content: We had a fabulous stay in Orlando, we were down for a family event, as well as taking in the parks. The rooms were clean, the continental breakfast was good, and the service was outstanding! We specifically want to give a shout out to Daniel ! Every evening we returned to his smiling face, offering us warm cookies and pleasant conversation. We will definitely stay here again upon our next visit to Orlando. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “this is the best hotel to stay at in the orlando area”
Reviews.Author: terrella
Reviews.Content: i loved the personal care and attention i recieved. i felt like i was staying with family.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: DorsetNetti
Reviews.Content: This was our first hotel as part of our tour around Florida and set a high president for the others to follow. It provides free parking and has a good range of eateries nearby epecially the Golden Coral. The staff were helpful and during our stay got to know Daniel on Reception well. He is full of character and so helpful and friendly and was sad to say goodbye to him (and the cookies!) We had a great time here, did not use any of the facilities due to being at Universal all the time. It is a great location for Universal with a lovely walk to the park. The breakfast is great- lots of choice frequently stocked- over our trip it had the most choice of all the hotels we stayed at- very impressed and set you up for the day. There is complimentary tea/coffee available in reception.(as well as coffee in rooms) As we travelled round Florida we soon realised just how good this hotel was with all the little extras eg great breakfast, sweets, cookies, tea/coffee etc. Would definately recommend this hotel for international drive and universal sides

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Great Stay!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: bmurphy0274
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying in Orlando so I wasn't familiar with the hotels chain. I did a lot a research on this hotel and boy i was happy about my selection. The Fairfield Inn and Suites near Universal had a warm and friendly atmosphere the staff was awesome and very helpful I enjoy everything about my stay. The hotel was very clean and the rooms were amazing too. The beds were soft and great after a long day of theme parks. The breakfast was always hot and good to the stomach. I plan on visiting Orlando again and I know where I'm going to stay. Thanks Trip Advisors for help me find the hidden gem!!!!

Reviews.Title: “friendly and great location”
Reviews.Author: ladyinredMiami
Reviews.Content: I was taking a fairly large group to a dance competition and everyone I dealt with was very friendly and accommodating. My parents were super happy which is always a great relief! The front desk staff were very sweet and one employee was particularly great with all the kids and made them feel very important. The location is great with a Starbucks right across the parking lot along with quite a few restaurants and a walgreens too. Covered all our needs! Hotel was clean and breakfast (included in price) was good. My only thing I would like to see improved are the beds as they were just a little too soft for me and my husband who then woke me when he moved around. This was a great hotel and right across the street from Universal.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with very few problems!”
Reviews.Author: Rides_And_Free_Beer
Reviews.Content: A really friendly and "cosy" feeling hotel. Rooms are well stocked, and come with free coffee, soap and Pantene products, replenished daily. Housekeeping is excellent. Rooms are a little smaller than we are used to at this price, but this is made up for with the generous free breakfast provided. It's worth asking for a room that does not overlook the parking lot/car park, as there is noise from there late at night, as the windows are not double-glazed. Front desk staff were excellent and friendly, and as this is a smaller hotel it is nice to see the same faces day-to-day. All in all a really good, relaxing stay.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy”
Reviews.Author: jas45
Reviews.Content: Check in was easy and friendly. We then went drove to Universal and stayed until closing. Upon arriving back at the hotel we found that there were no parking spots in the hotel or nearby lots. After finding someone backing out of a spot we go up to our room for a good nights sleep. Inconsiderate loud talkers periodically in the hallway and doors slamming made sleeping a problem. In the morning I realized that we were next to the stairs which a lot of people would use instead of waiting for the elevator. The stairwell is a VERY loud echo chamber and the doors slam shut due to fire regulations. I would stay here again with two exceptions, first NOT in a room near the stairs and second not on a Saturday night when you may not get a parking spot if you leave. If you stay here be certain that your not in the room next to or close to the stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: srcwad
Reviews.Content: Fantastic Hotel, This is our second time we stayed at this hotel and we would definitely go back. the rooms are big and very clean, All the staff are fantastic epecially Laura and Manuel. the brakfast is very good too,

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING!!!”
Reviews.Author: Marriotttraveler1
Reviews.Content: I needed to extend my stay one additional day. I went on Marriott.com and the room rate was more for the additional day. I came in, checked in and let them know I needed to stay another nite but there was a price difference of $20 for the additional nite. Not only did they extend my stay, they gave me the same nite rate as my original reservation AND placed me in a suite for that rate. My experience at this hotel has always been good. I love the upscale remodeling, the professionalism and the helpfulness of the staff and the location. I recommended this hotel to my girlfriend who is staying here the weekend. Thanks for being wonderful Fairfield. From, a platinum member who travels 3/4 days per week and stays in many different Marriott properties.

Reviews.Title: “Not great but a decent place to spend the night”
Reviews.Author: favargas
Reviews.Content: Small hotel very convenient to universal; free continetal breakfast. The staff was very friendly and willing to help the couple of times I have stayed at this property

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location , great service.”
Reviews.Author: nkaston
Reviews.Content: Staff was the best! Kayla, Steffanie, Emmanoel, Franklin and Angela were really concerned about you getting the most out of your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Midlands UK”
Reviews.Author: dawnjotham
Reviews.Content: We spent 14 nights at this hotel and it was really nice. The staff were very friendly the hotel was clean. the room was really good could not hear any noise from other rooms. highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but in a busy area”
Reviews.Author: NorfolkDude
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at this Fairfield on our trip south to Disney. In total for this trip we spent three nights in three different Fairfield Inns. A few of the Pros: - The beds were as comfortable as the other two Fairfield Inns, so the quality was consistent. - The hotel was well kept. - Front desk employees were very friendly. - Breakfast bar was well maintained and delicious! - A very nice Italian restaurant (Carmela's) is right around the corner. A few of the Cons: - A nearby fire station could stir up quite a commotion, when the fire trucks would roll out. - Universal Studios is right around the corner, so there is a critical mass of hotels in a small area. This Fairfield is squeezed in behind a strip mall on one side, a busy road on the other and two other hotels on the remaining sides. Consequently, the parking lot fills up quickly. Overall, this Fairfield is a nice hotel and we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Fairfield Universal”
Reviews.Author: robvia
Reviews.Content: Booked hotel for 1 night on Saturday October 18th, 2008. Room was clean, everything in order. The breakfast area had the nicest lady attending to the needs of the guests. She was cleaning tables, making waffles, seeing if they wanted whip cream on their waffles, and giving them bags for any food they wanted to take away. I've never seen anything like this in a free breakfast area. Sure, there's someone who will clean the tables, but this person was actually serving people. I don't know where all the bad reviews came from in previous posts, but our stay was nice. The hotel is within walking distance of Universal. It's about a 10 minute walk across Kirkman Road to the parking garage, but it's better than paying $12.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: BatonRougeFamily
Reviews.Content: I was bound to be disappointed with my reservation...I paid $358 for 2 nights. I wanted to book the Homewood Suites/Orlando after a great experience with them (using tripadvisor ratings for Albuquerque). They were full. I had a REALLY good experience with the Comfort Suites Universal in 2006 and wanted to see if I could get a better deal. I went with "Fairfield" thinking I was booking the #1 hotel with Tripadvisor. 2 weeks prior to my vacation I realized that when I went to the Marriott website to book my vacation I was somehow switched to a different Fairfield Inns & Suites. I kept the reservation hoping it would be okay. I had hoped to have a reservation including 2 rooms, one with 2 queen beds and a living room with sleeper sofa and TV...plus kitchenette including microwave and refrigerator. Boy was I disappointed when I received one room...NO Refrigerator...NO Microwave. Two beds plus a small sleeper ....SMALL SMALL SMALL. In 2006 We had stayed at the Comfort Suites Universal and received a MUCH BETTER DEAL.....2 beds with larger sleeper sofa....Large rectangle refrigerator and microwave plus some snacks provided. I would stay there again...it was cheaper than this stay! .... I will never stay at this Fairfield again. To me, there are much better deals than this. And I am one of those reviewers that really are more positive than I should be. To recover from the shock....we requested a refrigerator and they complied. However the refrigerator they sent was so small and never really worked. No microwave. The breakfast was (to me) not as great as Comfort Suites. Basically the same but no sausage. They had Breakfast Sandwiches, you cook them in the paper. The most positive thing I can say about this place is that they are very very close to Universal so that when the 'bus' came we were the last 'pick up ' and one of the first 'drop off' stops to get on. You are close to a Burger KIng, a Golden Corral, a Carraba's and there is a Convenience Store close by. The Cookies were nice at check in as was the Check in Clerk. There is a really nice Housekeeping guy that taught me some Spanish at the elevator. They have Lancome Shampoo and Conditioner. This is not the best deal available in Orlando....Please shop around.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the price”
Reviews.Author: ztheworld
Reviews.Content: Very convenient location for The Holyland Experience and Universal Studios, just minutes away. Above average free breakfast in the morning and fresh baked cookies in the afternoon. Rooms and hallways have just been updated. Beds are very comfortable. Suite rooms have cooling challenges, with one wall unit by the window. The bathroom and hallway side of room get extremely warm, while the bed area has the A/C unit blowing directly on you as you sleep. Overall, this is a good value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs. Go to the Fairfield International instead!”
Reviews.Author: welookgoodcom
Reviews.Content: I ended up staying at both the Fairfield Universal and the Fairfield Internation. Not for good reasons The Fairfield Universal is a dump! Avoid at all costs. The hotel was so horrible I needed to cut my stay short and take an emergancy cab ride to the Fairfield International Drive. The Fairfield International Drive is a 5 star resort compared to the Fairfield Universal. My issues: 1. I called up to get a non-feather pillow due to someone in the party who is allergic. I was told the hotel doesn't have them. As a result the person slept without pillows. 2. I was told on the phone the pool was heated. It is not. It's freezing cold 3. The jacuzzi is too hot so it's not possible to go in. Owning a jacuzzi I like it as hot as possible (107, 108). The temperature was so hot, its not fit for a human to go in. As a result I burned myself. The Fairfield International has a heated pool and a jacuzzi at the perfect temp 4. It is NOT within walking distance to Universal. Complete lie. 5. The room #s have paper signs. Nice touch! 6. The Fairfield Universal is not in a safe area. The Fairfield International is in a much safer hotel complex. I booked the Fairfield Inn & Suites Orlando Near Universal Orlando Resort thinking it was nicer since it was more expensive than the Fairfield International. Huge mistake! Still have the burn from their jacuzzi. By the way both hotels use the same complimentary shuttle service. By staying at the FFI International you are costing yourself an extra 8 min each way but much better off! If you have a choice stay at the Fairfield International. Save some $ and be much happier with a HIGHER QUALITY HOTEL. Front desk is extra friendly. Do NOT STAY AT THE Fairfield Inn & Suites Orlando Near Universal Orlando Resort. For reference I am a Marriott Platinum who stays at all brand of Marriott very frequently!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Location!”
Reviews.Author: Schrutenator
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel October 15th-18th 2007 for our 1 year anniversary. We wanted a clean, smoke free hotel, with free parking, free internet, free breakfast, in a safe location. We got everything we wanted! It is in a great location, right next to the entrance of Universal and close to International Drive (for restaurants, entertainment, and shopping). We stayed in a King Suite with a fridge/microwave. It was nice to sit on the couch and watch t.v. and then go to the "bedroom." The mattress was firm and comfortable. The hotel is very clean and the internet connection was great because the cord could reach the table, couch, and the bed. They had all the amenities that anyone would want (Pantene shampoo/conditioner, blow dryer, iron/board, newspaper, pool, small workout room etc.) Our room 616 was great because it was close but far enough away from the elevator and exit doors so noise wasn't a problem. The only issue we had, and it would be the same way in any of the area hotels, was the fire station that was across the street. The alarms would go off in the middle of the night (2-3 times a night, bring ear plugs) but obviously there is nothing you can do about that. There are restaurants within walking distance (Burger King, Kobe Japanese Steakhouse, Starbucks, Golden Corral Buffet, Carrabba's Italian Grill) and a Walgreen's that's great for anything you may have forgotten. The continental breakfast was nice, there were make your own waffles machines, bagels and other breads, hard boiled eggs, cereal, fresh fruit, coffee & tea, fruit juice etc. The cleaning staff even cleaned our room after we left the room after 2:00pm. The hotel staff was accommodating, we didn't use the shuttle but saw it picking up people for Universal right on time. For $99 a night plus taxes, it is a great deal!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for a Family!!!”
Reviews.Author: weluv2travellots
Reviews.Content: OVERALL- a great hotel. Rated as a 2 star, but clean and comfortable. We stayed at other 2 stars in florida, and this far exceeded what we expected. Cheapest price was through the Universal Studios website. Booked a King suite. Worth the little bit extra if traveling with kids. You get a divided off king size bed and an extra T.V. Saw the standard rooms (2 double beds) and they looked like the run of the mill hotel rooms...pay the extra for the suite. They have a little fridge and microwave, so bring your own popcorn and snacks. THE BEDS-The beds are VERY comfortable. Pillows are 1st class. Rooms are always clean. Breakfast is good...if they don't have what you are looking for, ask. The staff is very helpful. THE SHUTTLE-the only glitch in our stay. Watch the shuttle schedule-it changes (I think on Sundays) so every week is different. We got stuck paying for a ride home after a day at the park because the change...I told the front desk they should advise the guest of the change/when it changes, because it was very inconvienent to have to try and get back...expecting the shuttle. There are several shuttles during the morning, and several pick-up times in the evening. GREAT for people that want to sleep in, or go before the crowds. THE POOL-clean and well kept. Had to ask a few times for the pool towels to be brought out, but the staff was always friendly, and prompt. GREAT VALUE- I'd highly recommend this hotel to anyone. There is laundry on site (but be aware the hotel next door sends over their guests) which is good to use late at night, and reasonably priced. The rooms are clean and nicely furnished. Staff was friendly, and helpful. Location is kind of off the beaten track...but keeps the noise down. If you are energetic, you can almost walk to food stores. Would go back :')

Reviews.Title: “A high quality hotel at a good value”
Reviews.Author: VikGranger_IN
Reviews.Content: This is overall a very good quality hotel for a family visiting Universal Studios. It is a Universal "Partner" hotel, and hence has complimentary transportation to and from the park. The room and amenities were of high quality and the complimentary continental breakfast was top notch. My wife particularly liked the belgian waffle mix. Staff was friendly and helpful. Several restaurants are within walking distance, including one that is open late (I can't recall the name, but it was good). Two notes of caution: (1) The bus service was good, but the schedule was very imprecise. For example, a couple times the 10:30 AM bus never showed up because it overfilled from another hotel, so the 11:00 AM bus showed up (at 10:50 AM) to serve both 10:30 and 11:00 AM passesngers. Bottom line - the published schedule is not exact, but in the end, they'll get you there and back. (2) Be sure you get on the right bus coming back, especially if you wait till the midnight City Walk bus. There are two Fairfield Inns in the same general area - be sure you communicate clearly with the driver which one you're going to (the one on "Vineland").

Reviews.Author: madennis
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with good breackfast but you need a good meal after a sleepless nights the walls are so thin you can hear everything. Weekends in may are very noisey as school kids stay there and run and shout in the rooms
